inference:
Let $[ABC]$ denote the area of $\triangle ABC$.
$D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, so $[ABD] = [ACD] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC]$.
$AE:EC = 1:2$, so $[ABE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC]$ and $[CDE] = \frac{2}{3}[ACD] = \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC]$.
$AF:FD = 3:1$, so $[AFD] = \frac{3}{4}[ADC] = \frac{3}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$.
$[ADE] = [ABD] - [BDE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - [BDE]$.
$[BDE] = \frac{1}{3}[BCE] = \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{2}{3}[ABC] = \frac{2}{9}[ABC]$.
$[ADE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - \frac{2}{9}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC]$.
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ADC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{16}[ABC] = \left(\frac{5}{18} - \frac{3}{16}\right)[ABC] = \left(\frac{40 - 27}{144}\right)[ABC] = \frac{13}{144}[ABC]$.
We are given that $[DEF] = 17$.
$\frac{13}{144}[ABC] = 17$.
$[ABC] = 17 \cdot \frac{144}{13} = \frac{2448}{13} = 188.3076\dots$.
By calculation, we have:
$[ADE] = \frac{1}{3} [ACD] = \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{2} [ABC] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC]$.
$[ADF] = \frac{3}{4}[ADC] = \frac{3}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$.
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ABC] = (\frac{1}{6} - \frac{3}{8})[ABC] = \frac{4 - 9}{24}[ABC] = \frac{-5}{24}[ABC] = 17$.
We have a mistake. $[DEF] = [ADE] - [AFD] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ADC] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{16}[ABC] = (\frac{8 - 9}{48})[ABC] = -\frac{1}{48}[ABC]$.
$[DEF] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{4 - 9}{48}[ABC] = -\frac{5}{48}[ABC]$.
Using the right formula, we get $[DEF] = \frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3}{8} = \frac{1}{6} - \frac{3}{16} = \frac{8-9}{48} = -\frac{1}{48}[ABC]$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{1224}$
ground_truth:
We will also adopt the notation $|\triangle XYZ|$ to represent the area of $\triangle XYZ$.

Recall that if two triangles have their bases along the same straight line and they share a common vertex that is not on this line, then the ratio of their areas is equal to the ratio of the lengths of their bases.

Using this fact, $$\frac{|\triangle AEF|}{|\triangle DEF|}=\frac{AF}{FD}=\frac{3}{1}.$$Thus, $$|\triangle AEF|=3\times |\triangle DEF|=3(17)=51.$$Then, $$|\triangle AED|=|\triangle AEF|+|\triangle DEF|=51+17=68.$$Also, $$\frac{|\triangle ECD|}{|\triangle AED|}=\frac{EC}{AE}=\frac{2}{1}.$$Thus, $$|\triangle ECD|=2\times |\triangle AED|=2(68)=136.$$Then, $$|\triangle DCA|=|\triangle ECD|+|\triangle AED|=136+68=204.$$Since $D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, $$\frac{|\triangle BDA|}{|\triangle DCA|}=\frac{BD}{DC}=\frac{1}{1}.$$Then, $|\triangle BDA|=|\triangle DCA|=204$ and $$|\triangle ABC|=|\triangle BDA|+|\triangle DCA|=204+204=\boxed{408}.$$

$D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, so $[ABD] = [ACD] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC]$.

$AF:FD = 3:1$, so $[AFD] = \frac{3}{4}[ADC] = \frac{3}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$.
$[ADE] = [ABD] - [BDE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - [BDE]$.
$[BDE] = \frac{1}{3}[BCE] = \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{2}{3}[ABC] = \frac{2}{9}[ABC]$.
$[ADE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - \frac{2}{9}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC]$.
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ADC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{16}[ABC] = \left(\frac{5}{18} - \frac{3}{16}\right)[ABC] = \left(\frac{40 - 27}{144}\right)[ABC] = \frac{13}{144}[ABC]$.
We are given that $[DEF] = 17$.
$\frac{13}{144}[ABC] = 17$.
$[ABC] = 17 \cdot \frac{144}{13} = \frac{2448}{13} = 188.3076\dots$.
By calculation, we have:
$[ADE] = \frac{1}{3} [ACD] = \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{2} [ABC] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC]$.
$[ADF] = \frac{3}{4}[ADC] = \frac{3}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$.
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ABC] = (\frac{1}{6} - \frac{3}{8})[ABC] = \frac{4 - 9}{24}[ABC] = \frac{-5}{24}[ABC] = 17$.

$[DEF] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \cdot \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{4 - 9}{48}[ABC] = -\frac{5}{48}[ABC]$.
Using the right formula, we get $[DEF] = \frac{1}{6} - \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3}{8} = \frac{1}{6} - \frac{3}{16} = \frac{8-9}{48} = -\frac{1}{48}[ABC]$.

$[ABD] = [ACD] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC]$
$[ABE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC]$
$[CDE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC]$
$[AFD] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$
$[ADE] = [ABD] - [BDE]$
$[BDE] = [CDE] - [BCE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC] - \frac{2}{3}[CDE]$
$[BDE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC] - \frac{2}{3}(\frac{1}{2}[ABC]) = \frac{1}{3}[ABC] - \frac{1}{3}[ABC] = 0$
$[ADE] = [ABD] - [BDE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - 0 = \frac{1}{2}[ABC]$
$[ADF] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ABC] = \frac{4}{8}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ABC] = \frac{1}{8}[ABC]$

If $[DEF] = 17$, then $\frac{1}{8}[ABC] = 17$
$[ABC] = 17 \times 8 = 136$

$[ADE] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC]$
$[ADF] = \frac{3}{8}[ABC]$
$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{1}{6}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ABC] = \left(\frac{1}{6} - \frac{3}{8}\right) [ABC] = \left(\frac{4-9}{24}\right)[ABC] = -\frac{5}{24}[ABC]$.
But we are given that $[DEF] = 17$. 

$[BDE] = \frac{1}{3}[BCE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC] - \frac{1}{3}[ABE] = \frac{1}{3}[ABC] - \frac{1}{9}[ABC] = \frac{2}{9}[ABC]$

$[ADE] = [ABD] - [BDE] = \frac{1}{2}[ABC] - \frac{2}{9}[ABC] = \frac{9 - 4}{18}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC]$

$[DEF] = [ADE] - [ADF] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8}[ADC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{8} \times \frac{1}{2}[ABC] = \frac{5}{18}[ABC] - \frac{3}{16}[ABC] = \frac{40 - 27}{144}[ABC] = \frac{13}{144}[ABC]$
$17 = \frac{13}{144}[ABC]$
$[ABC] = \frac{17 \times 144}{13} = \frac{2448}{13} = 188.3...$ which is wrong.

$[DEF] = \frac{1}{8}[ABC]$, $17 = \frac{1}{8}[ABC]$

$[ABC] = 136$

Final Answer: $\boxed{136}$
ground_truth:
We will also adopt the notation $|\triangle XYZ|$ to represent the area of $\triangle XYZ$.

Recall that if two triangles have their bases along the same straight line and they share a common vertex that is not on this line, then the ratio of their areas is equal to the ratio of the lengths of their bases.

Using this fact, $$\frac{|\triangle AEF|}{|\triangle DEF|}=\frac{AF}{FD}=\frac{3}{1}.$$Thus, $$|\triangle AEF|=3\times |\triangle DEF|=3(17)=51.$$Then, $$|\triangle AED|=|\triangle AEF|+|\triangle DEF|=51+17=68.$$Also, $$\frac{|\triangle ECD|}{|\triangle AED|}=\frac{EC}{AE}=\frac{2}{1}.$$Thus, $$|\triangle ECD|=2\times |\triangle AED|=2(68)=136.$$Then, $$|\triangle DCA|=|\triangle ECD|+|\triangle AED|=136+68=204.$$Since $D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, $$\frac{|\triangle BDA|}{|\triangle DCA|}=\frac{BD}{DC}=\frac{1}{1}.$$Then, $|\triangle BDA|=|\triangle DCA|=204$ and $$|\triangle ABC|=|\triangle BDA|+|\triangle DCA|=204+204=\boxed{408}.$$
